column4: Can anyone help me? Whenever I do glxgears it says segmentation fault.
same with glxdemo
and the same with glxinfo
what video card and drivers?
ATI mobility radeon 5730, and the proprietary one from additional driver
could try uninstalling it then reinstalling
Which one is the driver? I end up with 2 VGA controllers
where do you see 2 vga controllers listed? also try fglrxinfo
Segmentation fault
guess there could be more that one vid card in the system? could try disabling one in bios
this command sometimes helps me: sudo aticonfig --initial
Do I -have- to disable the discrete graphics for ubuntu to work?
probably not, just might make things easier
might want to open synaptic and see if you really have the fglrx packages installed ok
It says installed
which packages are installed already, all the ones from a fglrx search?
might not hurt to reinstall
Maybe the intel video card is screwing things up
try searching to see if some intel driver got installed by mistake? what you should see when installing the fglrx driver is that it recompiles the kernel with dkms and such
also could try reinstalling fglrx from command line to look for errors
if it is an intel card maybe search for intel in synaptic? also might want to use a grub editor to select an old kernel if the problem appeared recently
I uninstalled my old kernels D:
